name: Holiday Inn Express Washington DC - BW Parkway

reviews.text: We stayed here during a family vacation to D.C. About a 20 min drive into D.C. or the metro station is a 5-8 min drive away. The staff is very courteous and meet your request with a smile. We stayed here because of the free breakfast bar, which was adequate. Just your basic breakfast with hot and cold breakfast items. Room was clean no ordors or carpet stains. Bathrooms wer clean as well but a little small. Location is a little shady. I never felt unsafe, but I wouldn't venture far with my family on foot. No sit down restaurants nearby, only a couple of fast food places. There is a walmart 2-3 minute drive away.
reviews.title: Meets your basic needs

reviews.text: Was pleasantly satisfied with our stay at this hotel. We arrived late at night and the security guard and front desk personnel were very friendly. Our room was very nicely made up. We had the breakfast in the morning which we were very satisfied with - eggs, bacon, pancakes, cereal, breads, yogurts, coffees, etc....all that we ask for in the included buffet. The woman running the breakfast was very nice and helpful and kept the area fully stocked. The individuals at front desk at check out were friendly and efficient too. It was a quick ride (20 minutes) to where we were going in DC (the Newseum). Definitely would stay again and save on the high prices of DC hotels if just needing a night's rest.
reviews.title: Nice Overnight Stay When Visiting DC

reviews.text: My stays at this hotel was awesome. Whenever my company sends me out here to conduct business here is where I always stay. The location is very convenient to Wash, DC. The management and front desk staff are friendly and courteous. They welcome you when walking in, already have your room keys waiting so you dont have to wait in line. The rooms are clean from top to bottom. Trust me from staying in allot of hotels I inspect. The facilty has a gym with top of the line equipment. Plus this hotel has great breakfast, not just the complimentary. You have eggs,bacon, fruits,etc. they have enough parking plus they have cameras inside and outside the building. I felt secure while staying there. Stores and resturants close to the hotel so you won't have to go far.
reviews.title: A MUST STAY HOTEL.......

reviews.text: Overall its a great place to stay especially when any sports games are in town.
reviews.title: My stay at this hotel was very pleasant, quiet and relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are staying here tonight, and have no problems with this hotel and we only stay at Holiday Inn Express Hotels so we are very familiar with their standards, this one compares nicely. The room is a bit small, but well maintained, clean, and comfortable. The carpet looks new and plush, the shower is big enough and very clean. This hotel is more affordable than other HIE's in the DC area, we are en route to NC. The front desk girl was very professional and we love the security feature of a key card to activate the elevator. Don't worry about the neighborhood we were just fine wandering around by car looking for food, the people go about their business minding their business, at least that has been our experience. We ended up right next door at the Pizza place which we highly recommend, there's a very nice choice of pastas and seafood. We had the spaghetti with sausage and a steak sandwich, don't bother to look for food around here because there's very limited choices such as a Burger King and a McDonald's and a smattering of small eateries. The good places are a fifteen minute drive from here, so either bring your food in or go next door, it is very affordable. Don't worry about the hotel it is not run down, it is very pleasant, granted we have seen some really upscale HIE's but this one is fantastic for the price, don't be a snob.
reviews.title: Great Hotel Good Value

reviews.text: The building was older than expected and the rooms were not nearly as nice as we've seen in other Holiday Inn Express hotels. The property was fenced and the elevator required keycard access, so we assumed that the immediate area wasn't necessarily safe. I would recommend more extensive renovation of the rooms to better match the lobby/entrance area. Not sure what can be done about the fence and safety of the location... maybe it is not the best location for a Holiday Inn Express. The service and staff were excellent though.
reviews.title: Great chain, but this location doesn't measure up

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Metro station is 2.5 miles away and is not walk-able. The free shuttle service to the Metro station is nice, but not available on Sundays or past 10pm. We paid enough money in taxi fare to have stayed at a hotel in the city for a bit more money per night -- a hotel not in a scary part of town and one right next to a Metro station. If none of that bothers you, the hotel was nice and clean with friendly service and good breakfast. And a security guard onsite at night to keep the scary out of the hotel. Oh, but no cold water in the tap or shower -- just one temperature, luke warm in both.
reviews.title: Scary part of town, pay the extra money to stay in the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in our weekend long trip to Washington DC. Hotel is at an easily locatable place since it's on highway and even though it's on highway, it takes care of your needs because there is a Walmart right across the street and also an Italian restaurant adjacent. Rooms were though not very spacious but clean & nicely furnished. I completely loved the shower cabin with glass door since I do not like the idea of a shower-tub combination bathroom with baby-sized bathtubs. I really appreciated the concept of sound proof windows since the hotel is on highway. People at front-desk are very helpful. Breakfast bar was though not very lavish, but quit adequate. Fitness center is too small however it didn't matter much as we didn't use it. I was happy to see a soda vending machine & an ice machine right outside our room. Hallway is a beautifully decorated and elevators quit spacious. King sized bed was very comfortable. Housekeeping lady cleaned the whole bathroom floor unlike other hotels where they just change towels and empty the trash on the name of housekeeping. My husband forgot to carry his shaving kit and was happy to see that hotel provided shaving accessories free of cost. Only problem we faced during our stay was AC was very noisy and we couldn't sleep well with the AC on so we had to turn it off both nights however front desk guy was more than apologetic and offered us 2000 benefit priority club points for the inconvenience. Overall it was a pleasant stay and we are happy customers :)
reviews.title: Worth every penny spent

reviews.text: There was a women of questionable character outside the front door,stuff happening in the parking lot and the bed felt like the sheets were not entirely dry.It was a very bad night here. The day manager said that he can't help what happens outside his place but it was on his property. The damp bed situation was really bad too.
reviews.title: This was not a good experience!
